titles.title: Relating to Taiwan's participation in the World Health Organization.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Mr. Solomon moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Solomon objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required): 418 - 0 (Roll No. 517).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/7/1998--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) Taiwan should have appropriate and meaningful participation in the World Health Organization; and (2) it should be U.S. policy to pursue some initiative in the World Health Organization which will give Taiwan meaningful participation in a manner that is consistent with such organization's requirements.
